project.teaser: INGUMA aims to foster the development of bio-based materials and their acceptance by the public by relying on three main values sustainability, inclusion, and aesthetics - the values of the New European Bauhaus.The value of sustainability will be tackled by developing...
project.objective:
INGUMA aims to foster the development of bio-based materials and their acceptance by the public by relying on three main values sustainability, inclusion, and aesthetics - the values of the New European Bauhaus.
The value of sustainability will be tackled by developing different types of bio-based materials from raw materials derived from agriculture residues and secondary raw materials from wood processing. Various types of materials will be developed: functionalized fibers, insulation material based on mycelium, resin-free insulation material based on wood fibers, bio-based adhesive for plywood, low-formaldehyde plywood board, wooden sandwich panels, and growth media for plants. In addition, these materials will be integrated into insulation panels and vegetated roofs.
The sustainability and circularity of these materials and solutions will be ensured by applying environmental criteria and digital tools that will allow users to make decisions on the most sustainable solutions available. Additionally, the materials will be tested according to European and international standards, as a first step in the commercialization outside of Europe (Canada).
The value of inclusion will imply the design of co-creation laboratories that encourage collaboration among stakeholders, fostering transparent communication and generating innovative ideas. These labs will provide a platform for engagement and a structured process for stakeholders to contribute their insights and actively participate in the development of bio-based construction materials. This way, the acceptance of the developed materials, products and solutions by end-users and consumers will be maximized.
The value of aesthetics will be accomplished by co- designing and constructing a community house prototype in the rooftop of an experimental building (Derio, Spain) and as part of test houses (Savonlinna, Finland) that will use extensively the materials and products developed.
project.title: ReducINg the footprint of consumer products through public dialoGUe and innovative bio-based MAterials
project.keywords: bio-based, adhesive, plywood, sandwich panels, insulation boards, plywood, substrate, green roof, co-design labs, design thinking, policymakers, experimental building, test houses, LCA, digital tools

article.title: Sustainability, inclusion, and aesthetics in bio-based materials

result.title: Gender Analysis Report v1
result.description: The leader and main contributor is TECN. The rest of the consortium members will contribute with their own experiences.This report will contain a second version (M18) of a Gender Equity Management (defining the initial steps of the project and the outline guidelines, an action plan, and corresponding monitoring indicators to promote gender balance across various aspects of the project). A second part will be an analysis of the existing state of gender-related research in the context of bio-based construction materials. Additionally, it will involve the implementation and subsequent analysis of an internal survey within the INGUMA project to provide insights into the current state of art. It will include all the outputs of the Task 7.4.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - INGUMA (ReducINg the footprint of consumer products through public dialoGUe and innovative bio-based MAterials)
result.teaser: Replacing mineral- and fossil-based construction materials with bio-based alternatives offers significant potential to lower atmospheric carbon levels and reduce greenhouse gas emissions from the building sector. This transition plays a crucial role in rebalancing the global...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

webItem.alternativeText: Testing samples of the structural insulation panels
Draft design of the demo community house showcasing projects products

result.title: Data management plan v1
result.description: "The leader and main contributor is TECN. The rest of the consortium members will contribute with their own data strategy.The plan will include the outline of the datasets foreseen throughout the duration of the project and the datasets generated until M18, while simultaneously defining the data management strategy. Given the diverse range of data types that will emerge in the course of the project, this report aims to supply pertinent insights and direction for the accurate administration of these various datasets. The strategy will be based on Task 7.3 and section ""1.2.7 - Data management and management of other research outputs"""

result.title: Stakeholder Engagement Plan
result.description: The leader is FNR and the other main contributors will be IW and TECN.According to Task 2.1, the report will outline the formats and co-creation methods to be applied, as a guideline to run the co-creation process for the clustered stakeholders.

result.title: Ideation phase for each cluster
result.description: "The leader is FNR and the other main contributors will be TECN and IW.This report will describe the results of ""Phase 1 - Exploitation and ideation"" in the process of the co-creation labs for each stakeholder cluster according to the tasks described in Task 2.2."

result.title: Communication, Dissemination & Exploitation Plan v1
result.description: The leader and main contributor is G!E. The rest of the consortium members will contribute as well.The report will describe a first version the plan that will detail the communication and dissemination channels to be employed, highlight relevant events and conferences, and clearly define the roles and obligations of the project partners. It will define guidelines to ensure the validation of communication and dissemination content, thereby safeguarding partners' intellectual property. A map of the Key Exploitable Results will also be conducted according to Task 6.1 and Task 6.4.This deliverable will include also the foreseen actions for the next period.

result.title: Report on Communication, Dissemination & Networking Activities v1
result.description: The leader and main contributor is G!E. The rest of the consortium members will contribute as well.This report will include all the communication, dissemination and networking activities developed until M18 of the project according to the progress of Task 6.2, Task 6.3, Task 6.4 and Task 6.5.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
